tei:
<pb n="92"/>
<list>
<item>L “Subsidized Patronage,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 28 January 1970, p. 11. On U.S. tax relief<lb/>for gifts.</item>
<item>A “The Rare Book Market, 1928-1968: A Retrospective Impression,” <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 45 (1970 [2-9 February]): 339-44. Reprints “The Market”<lb/>section from his address to the Bibliographical Society on 18 November 1969, published in the 1970 impression of <hi rend="italic">Taste and Technique in Book-Collecting</hi> (A:1948).</item>
<item>O “Mr Dennis Cohen: Publisher and Connoisseur,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 26 February 1970, p. 12. Unsigned.</item>
<item>A “How We Got Wise,” <hi rend="italic">The Sunday Times Magazine</hi> [London], 8 March 1970, pp. 38, 41, 43-44. A draft of this article (along with a copy of the <hi rend="italic">Enquiry</hi>) was<lb/>displayed in a 1971 exhibition at Eton (marking the dedication of the library’s renovated spaces) and recorded in the catalogue, <hi rend="italic">Twentieth Century Manuscripts<lb/>and First Editions from the Eton School Library</hi>.</item>
<item>R [Review of Warner Barnes’s bibliography of Elizabeth Barrett Browning], <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> 19 (1970 [Spring]): 101-04.</item>
<item>L “Mrs Caroline Thorpe,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 3 July 1970, p. 10. Unsigned.</item>
<item>L “Older Authors and Royalties Plan,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 16 October 1970, p. 11.</item>
<item>A “Sadleir Rides Again,” <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 46 (1970 [9 November]): 1364-66, 1368-70. Reprinted (with additions) from the <hi rend="italic">Times Literary Supplement</hi><lb/>(E2:1970, October). On a three-decker sale at Sotheby’s.</item>
</list>
<head>D:1971</head>
<list>
<item>O “Dr L. C. Wroth: A Distinguished Bibliographer,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 5 January 1971, p. 14.</item>
<item>L “Mr Eliot,” <hi rend="italic">The Listener</hi>, 14 January 1971, p. 74. On omissions in a BBC pro-<lb/>gram on T. S. Eliot. See also the next entry.</item>
<item>L “Mr Eliot,” <hi rend="italic">The Listener</hi>, 18 February 1971, p. 212. Correction of previous let-<lb/>ter regarding dates when Eliot and John Hayward shared quarters. See also<lb/>the preceding entry.</item>
<item>A “The Caxton Ovid,” <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> 20 (1971 [Spring]): 7-18.</item>
<item>A “Sotheby’s Retrospect & Prospect,” <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 48 (1971 [20 September]): 706, 708.</item>
<item>L [Letter on revising the <hi rend="italic">ABC</hi> (A:1952)], <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 48 (1971 [4-11 October]): 983.</item>
</list>
<head>D:1972</head>
<list>
<item>A “The Suzannet Sale at Sotheby’s,” <hi rend="italic">The Dickensian</hi> 68 (1972): 43-47.</item>
<item>N [Excerpt (first paragraph) from “Sotheby’s of London, New York: The Early Days” (C:1971)], <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 49 (1972 [29 March]): 1172.</item>
<item>L [Letter on the “wholly non-authorized reprint” of the <hi rend="italic">Enquiry</hi> (A:1934) by Haskell House], <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 49 (1972 [3-10 April]): 1291.</item>
<item>O “I. R. Brussel, L.O.G.S.,” <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> 21 (1972 [Autumn]): 402-05. Re-<lb/>printed in <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi> 50 (1972 [25 December]): 2096. It is said here<lb/>that a longer version of this piece would appear as the preface to a reprint of<lb/>Brussel’s <hi rend="italic">Anglo-American First Editions</hi> by Interland Press, but I have found no<lb/>evidence that this reprint occurred.</item>
</list>
